result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Georgette Camilla Martinez in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant Georgette Camilla Martinez in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 TR 463, 14 CT 58, 15 CF 52, 15 CF 50 and 15 CF 51.  3:41 PM  Court calls cases and recites appearances.

 14 CF 236 dismissed and used as read-in.  

State argues sentencing - OWI - 14 CT 58 - $1694.00 fine - 60 days county jail concurrent to 15 CF 50 and 15 CF 51 - 24 month revocation of dl - AODA with VIP - IID
  makes further stmt - 961.001 language (1r) / Sentence : 10 years each count 5 years in prison and 5 yrs ES consecutive to each other (15 CF 50 and 15 CF 51) - fines $1000.00 plus costs on each count - $140.00 restitution to the LCO police department - any assessments DOC may recommended - to maintain full time employment - DNA sample and surcharge - 148 days jail credit.     Atty Moldenhauer argues sentencing agrees to the guidelines on 14 CT 58 argues sentencing in 15 CF 50 and 15 CF 51 - if does not go along with probation requests orders the maximum JAIL time not prison time.  Defendant addressed the Court.

COURT:  14 CT 58 - fine $1694.00 - 60 days county jail concurrent with 15 CF 50  - DL revoked 24 months plus 60 days - AODA with VIP and IID 60 days months beginning on her release from prison $1000.00 bond to be applied to this case

15 CF 50 - 8 yrs in prison - 4 years in and 4 years ES
15 CF 51 - 8 yrs in prison - 4 yrs in and 4 years ES consecutive to 15 CF 50 - conditions in both - costs - dna sample - reimburse LCO Police Department of $140.00 restitution - eligible for earned release not eligible for challenge - complete any conditions DOC may impose - (15 CF 50 - 148 days credit time served) - to complete driver safety plan and victim impact panel - $1500.00 bond to be applied to the balance in 14 CT 58 then the balance to be forwarded to DOC to be applied to costs and restitution to LCO police department

Appeal rights given to the defendant / Court completes WEDS form document tendered to the defendant - court further addressed her as to this form

Defendant Georgette Camilla Martinez in court in custody with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Will not be dismissed today WILL BE dismissed at sentencing, bond continues.  PSI Ordered.   Parties free to argue at sentencing. Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Georgette C Martinez in court, appearing by video from custody, with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the Sawyer County.  Held off the record.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Georgette Camilla Martinez in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. OFF THE RECORD
DE waives time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 12-18-14 @ 3:15 pm.

APPEARANCES:  Defendant Georgette Camilla Martinez in court with Attorney Martin Jarvis.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint.  DE waived time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court entered NOT GUILTY plea on behalf of DE to Count 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Bruce Poquette appeared in person for the State.  DE appeared in person.  

State still pending police report.

John Yackel appeared in person for the State.  DE appeared via video means, in custody.

Court set $1,500 cash bond, with no special conditions.
